enum.name: ApiLasListIdType
enum.description: This enum defines the different list identifier.

member.name: API_LAS_ALL_INCOMING_CALLS
member.description: List with all incoming calls(includes all missed and incoming accepted calls)

enum.name: ApiLasRejectReasonType
enum.description: This enum defines start session reject types to the MMI

member.name: API_LAS_REJECT_LIST_ALREADY_IN_USE
member.description: List already used by another session.

member.name: API_LAS_REJECT_MAX_NR_OF_SESSIONS_REACHED
member.description: Maximum number of sessions supported by the FP reached

enum.name: ApiLasReadDirectionType
enum.description: This enum defines the direction of received list entries. The response contains data packets with list entries in order of ascending list index, regardless of whether counter indicated forward or backwards and always includes the entry with list index=start index. EXAMPLE: In case 2 entries are requested 'backwards' with start index 5, the data packets shall include the entries with indices 4 and 5, with entry 4 transmitted first.

enum.name: ApiLasReadStatusType
enum.description: Enum definition for ApiLasReadStatusType

member.name: API_LAS_READSTATUS_UNCHANGED
member.description: All read entries 'Read status' field shall be left unchanged

member.name: API_LAS_READSTATUS_READ
member.description: All read entries 'Read status' field shall be reset (i.e. marked as read)

member.name: API_LAS_READSTATUS_UNREAD
member.description: All read entries 'Read status' field shall be set (i.e. marked as unread)

enum.name: ApiLasSearchOptionType
enum.description: This enum defines the various match options for search commands

member.name: API_LAS_SEARCH_EXACT_MATCH
member.description: Exact match with whole target field required

member.name: API_LAS_SEARCH_EXACT_CURRENT_INDEX
member.description: Exact match as with 00H option tried, current start index returned if exact match fails

member.name: API_LAS_SEARCH_EXACT_PREVIOUS_INDEX
member.description: Exact match as with 00H option tried, previous start index returned if exact match fails

enum.name: ApiLasSearchCaseOptionType
enum.description: This enum defines the various match options for search commands

enum.name: ApiLasNegativeAcknowledgeReasonType
enum.description: This enum defines various errors codes received from the host

enum.name: ApiLasStatusType
enum.description: This enum defines various errors codes generated by the API

member.name: API_LAS_STATUS_INVALID_CONEI
member.description: No connection available. A connection needs to be established prior to any LAS activity (see ApiCc for further dertails).

member.name: API_LAS_STATUS_INVALID_AIR_CMD_RECEIVED
member.description: Invalid command received over the air

member.name: API_LAS_STATUS_INVALID_AIR_ENTRY_DATA_RECEIVED
member.description: Invalid entry data received over the air

member.name: API_LAS_STATUS_UNKNOWN_AIR_SESSIONID
member.description: Unknown session id was received over the air.

member.name: API_LAS_STATUS_UNEXPECTED_AIR_DATA_RECEIVED
member.description: Unexpected data received over the air.

member.name: API_LAS_STATUS_AIR_DATA_STORAGE_FULL
member.description: Too much data received over the air.

member.name: API_LAS_STATUS_INVALID_API_SESSIONID
member.description: Invalid session id was used in API command.

enum.name: ApiLasCallTypeType
enum.description: This enum defines the different Contact number types.

enum.name: ApiLasContactNumberTypeType
enum.description: This enum defines the different Contact number types.

enum.name: ApiLasCallInterceptionTypeType
enum.description: This enum defines the allowed call interception states.

enum.name: ApiLasClockMasterTypeType
enum.description: This enum defines the entity which sets date and time for the DECT system (PP or FP).

enum.name: ApiLasBaseResetTypeType
enum.description: This enum defines the Base Reset states

member.name: API_LAS_BASERESET_NO
member.description: If at least one DECT system setting, or line setting, has been set to a non default value, the 'Base reset' field will be equal to API_LAS_BASERESET_NO. Any attempt from a Pp to set this parameter to API_LAS_BASERESET_NO will result in a negative acknowledgement, with reject reason 'procedure not allowed'.

member.name: API_LAS_BASERESET_YES
member.description: All DECT system and line settings will be reset to their default value in the FP.

enum.name: ApiLasIpAdrTypeType
enum.description: This enum defines the IP Address types

enum.name: ApiLasIpAdrFormatType
enum.description: This enum defines the IP Address format

enum.name: ApiLasNoEmissionModeType
enum.description: This enum defines the No Emission states

enum.name: ApiLasMultipleCallModeType
enum.description: This enum defines the Multiple calls modes

enum.name: ApiLasIntrusionCallModeType
enum.description: This enum defines the Intrusion calls modes

enum.name: ApiLasPermanentClirTypeType
enum.description: This enum defined permanent CLIR types

enum.name: ApiLasCallForwardStateType
enum.description: This enum defined call forwarding types

member.name: API_LAS_CF_DEACTIVATE
member.description: Call forward de-activated for all calls

member.name: API_LAS_CF_ACTIVATE
member.description: Call forward activated for all calls

enum.name: ApiLasCountryCodeTypeType
enum.description: This enum defines the country codes supported by the API. Table is based on [3]

typedef.name: ApiLasEntryIdType
typedef.description: Unique Id of a list entry

typedef.name: ApiLasEntryIndexType
typedef.description: The index number on an entry in the a sorted list

typedef.name: ApiLasNumberAttributesType
typedef.description: Number attributes. The value can be combined of one or more of the defined values below (ored together). All other values not described below are not valid and will be disregarded by the API.

typedef.name: ApiLasContactNumberAttributesType
typedef.description: Contact number attributes. The value can be combined of one or more of the defined values below (ored together). All other values not described below are not valid and will be disregarded by the API.

struct.description: This type is used for API_IE_LAS_DATE_TIME infoElement

member.name: Editable
member.description: Read only or editable. Please refer to section 2 for further information on this setting.

member.name: TimeZone
member.description: The Time Zone indicates the difference, expressed in quarters of an hour, between the local time and GMT. In the first of the two semi-octets, the first bit represents the algebraic sign of this difference (0: positive; 1: negative). The Time Zone code enables the receiver to calculate the equivalent time in GMT from the other semi-octets in the element, or indicate the time zone (GMT, GMT+1H, etc.), or perform other similar calculations as required by the implementation.

member.name: PinProtected
member.description: Indicates if the InfoElement is PIN code protected. Please refer to section 2.5 for further information on this setting.

member.name: LineIdSubtype
member.description: Line identifier subtype. The following rules should be followed: For all call-related lists, the subtype shall be set to 'Line identifier for external call' (call is external). For the 'Contact list', subtype shall be set to 'Relating to' or 'All lines', depending on the contact. For the 'Line settings' list, and for any other list, the subtype shall be set to 'Relating to'.

member.name: PinCode[API_LAS_LENGTH_OF_PINCODE]
member.description: Each decimal digit shall be translated into one nibble (4 bits, BCD coded). If the entered pin is less than API_LAS_LENGTH_OF_PINCODE bytes long the leading nibbles should be padded with 0xF

struct.name: ApiLasBaseResetType
struct.description: This type is used for API_IE_LAS_ BASE_RESET infoElement

member.name: Editable
member.description: Read only or editable. Please refer to section 2 for further information on this setting.

member.name: PinProtected
member.description: Indicates if the InfoElement is PIN code protected. Please refer to section 2.5 for further information on this setting.

member.name: Reset
member.description: The Base reset field respect the following rules: If at least one DECT system setting, or line setting, has been set to a non default value, the Base reset field will be equal to False when a PP performs a read command. If a registered PP sets the value to True, all DECT system and line settings will be reset to their default value. The setting remains set to True until any DECT system or line setting is changed. Any attempt from to set this parameter to False will result in a negative acknowledgement.

struct.name: ApiLasAttachedHandsetsType
struct.description: This type is used for API_IE_LAS_ ATTACHED_HANDSETS infoElement

member.name: Editable
member.description: Read only or editable. Please refer to section 2 for further information on this setting.

member.name: PinProtected
member.description: Indicates if the InfoElement is PIN code protected. Please refer to section 2.5 for further information on this setting.

member.name: NumberOfAttachedHandsets
member.description:
This value tells how many handsets that are attached to this line (Number of bits set in the bitmap field).
NB. This value is automatically calculated by the API and should there for not be added when sending this InfoElement.

member.name: Bitmap
member.description:
The Bitmap is showing whish handsets that are connected to each line. Each handset is represented by a bit in this field
Bits 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 Meaning x x x x x x x 1 Handset nr 1 is attached x x x x x x 1 x Handset nr 2 is attached x x x x x 1 x x Handset nr 3 is attached x x x x 1 x x x Handset nr 4 is attached x x x 1 x x x x Handset nr 5 is attached x x 1 x x x x x Handset nr 6 is attached x 1 x x x x x x Handset nr 7 is attached 1 x x x x x x x Handset nr 8 is attached

member.description: Length in bytes of the CLIR activation code

member.name: ClirCodes
member.description: Each digit shall be out of interval 30H..39H, and values 23H, 2AH, 05H and 15H. The CLIR activation code should be placed first and the deactivation code second.

member.name: LengthOfActivationCode

member.name: LengthOfDeactivationCode
member.description: Length in bytes of the deactivation code

member.name: Data
member.description: Each digit shall be out of interval 30H..39H, and values 23H, 2AH, 05H and 15H. The Data should be arranged the following way: 1) Activation code 2) Deactivation code 3) CfNumber

member.name: DelayTime
member.description: Number of seconds before call is forwarded. Allowable values are 0 to 64. A value of zero indicates that the choice of the number of seconds is left to the FP (use of a default or preferred value configured in the FP).

member.name: LengthOfActivationCode
member.description: Length in bytes of the activation code

member.name: LengthOfDeactivationCode
member.description: Length in bytes of the deactivation code

member.name: Data
member.description: Each digit shall be out of interval 30H..39H, and values 23H, 2AH, 05H and 15H. The Data should be arranged the following way: 1) Activation code 2) Deactivation code 3) CfNumber

struct.name: ApiLasLockedEntriesListType
struct.description: This type is used for API_IE_LOCKED_ENTRIES_LIST infoElement

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to start up a list handling session with a specified list in FP.

parameter.name: ListIdentifier
parameter.description: Id of list to start session with

parameter.name: InfoElement

mail.description:
This mail is used by the API to inform the MMI that a session has been started with or without success.
Error cases: If a start settion request is sendt with an unsupported ListIdentifier, API_LAS_REJECT_LIST_NOT_SUPPORTED will be returned as reject reason.
If a start settion request is sendt before LAS has finished initializing, API_LAS_REJECT_NOT_ENOUGH_RESOURCES will be returned as reject reason.

parameter.name: ListIdentifier
parameter.description: Id of list to start session with

parameter.name: SessionIdentifier
parameter.description: Allocated session id reserved for the started session. Will be 0 in case of rejection.

parameter.name: NoOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in list related to session.

parameter.name: DiscriminatorType
parameter.description: API_LIST_DISCRIMINATOR_UNDEFINED or API_LIST_DISCRIMINATOR_EMC. If API_LIST_DISCRIMINATOR_UNDEFINED the following parameter is not used

parameter.name: RejectReason
parameter.description: Reject reason in case of reject

parameter.name: InfoElement

mail.description:
This mail is used by the MMI to end a list handling session with a specified list in FP. Remaining locked entries will be unlocked.
If SessionIdentifier is wrong command is ignored.
This mail is used by the API to inform the MMI that the session has ended.

This mail is used by the MMI to query FP about which fields are supported in the entries of a specific list.
If session id is wrong FP will answer back with negative acknowledgement (API_LAS_INVALID_SESSION_NO ) else confirm will be received.
This mail is used to confirm the API_LAS_END_REQ command.

parameter.name: InfoElement

mail.description:
This mail is used by the MMI to request one or more list entries in FP. The received list corresponds to the sorting and setup done by the start session command.
If StartIndex + NumberOfEntries is larget than the number of entries stored, FP will return the existing elements in the range in the confirm command.
If an unknown list entry field is requested the FP will ignore this field and continue with the next field.
If no errors: API will return API_LAS_READ_ENTRIES_CFM
If error: API will return API_LAS_NEGATIVE_ACKNOWLEDGE_IND with the following RejectReason: [API_LAS_INVALID_SESSION_NO] If SessionIdentifier is wrong. [API_LAS_INVALID_START_INDEX] If StartIndex is wrong. [API_LAS_INVALID_RANGE] If NumberOfEntries is larger than 0x7F.

parameter.name: StartIndex
parameter.description: Start number [0-0x3FFF] where: 0: Last entry in list 0x1 - 0x3FFF: Entry number in list

parameter.name: ReadDirection
parameter.description: This enum defines the direction of received list entries.

parameter.name: ReadStatus
parameter.description: Flag for requesting setting/resetting of the 'Read status' field for all read entrie. This field only applies to a list having a 'Read status' field, and is otherwise ignored.

parameter.name: InfoElement

mail.description: This mail is used by the API to tell the MMI about the received list entries. Content of list entry is transmitted in data packets. Content of list entry is transmitted in data packets.

parameter.name: StartIndex
parameter.description: Smallest index value of list response [0x1 - 0x3FFF]

mail.description:
This mail is used by the MMI to edit and lock one entry. FP prevent other PP's from changing the requested list entry until PP has sent the save entry command or the session is terminated. If session id is wrong FP will answer back with negative acknowledgement (API_LAS_INVALID_SESSION_NO ) else confirm will be received.
If an unknown entry identifier is requested FP will answer back with negative acknowledgement (API_LAS_ENTRY_NOT_AVAILABLE) else confirm will be received.
If an unknown list field identifier is requested FP will ignore this filed and continue.

parameter.name: InfoElement

mail.description: This mail is used by the API to tell the MMI that the entry has been locked and are ready for edit. Content of list entry is transmitted in data packets.

This mail is used by the MMI to request to save a new or existing list entry identified by the entry identifier. Corresponding entry is sent in data packets.
If the previously started edit procedure has to be terminated without changing the entry, PP shall perform the the save entry procedure with only one empty last data packet following after the save entry.
Fields which shall be deleted shall be sent back to FP with length 0.
List entries which are updated must have been locked using the edit command (except for new entries).
If session id is wrong FP will answer back with negative acknowledgement (API_LAS_INVALID_SESSION_NO ) else confirm will be received.
If entry identifier id is unknown FP will answer back with negative acknowledgement (API_LAS_ENTRY_NOT_AVAILABLE) else confirm will be received.
If a field content cannot be accepted FP will answer back with negative acknowledgement (API_LAS_CONTENT_NOT_ACCEPTED) else confirm will be received.
If an entry cannot be added to a list which cannot accept an additional entry, FP will answer back with negative acknowledgement (API_LAS_FULL) else confirm will be received.

parameter.name: EntryIdentifier
parameter.description: Id of entry. If 0 entry is new and no identifier has been assigned yet.

parameter.name: InfoElement

mail.description: This mail is used by the API to tell the MMI that an entry has been saved.

parameter.name: PositionNumber
parameter.description: Indicates the (possible new) index number of the entry in the list.

parameter.name: NoOfEntries
parameter.description: Total number of available entries in the list.

mail.description:
This mail is used by the MMI to request to delete one existing list entry.
If session id is wrong FP will answer back with negative acknowledgement (API_LAS_INVALID_SESSION_NO ) else confirm will be received.
If entry identifier id is unknown FP will answer back with negative acknowledgement (API_LAS_ENTRY_NOT_AVAILABLE) else confirm will be received.
It is not allowed to delete entries in List of supported lists and DECT system settings list. When doing this FP will answer back with negative acknowledgement (API_LAS_PROCEDURE_NOT_ALLOWED) else confirm will be received..
This mail is used by the API to tell the MMI that an entry has been deleted.

parameter.name: NumberOfEntriesLeft
parameter.description: Number of entries left in the list after deletion

mail.description:
This mail is used by the MMI to request a deletion of all entries in a list. The list itself will still remain.
If session id is wrong FP will answer back with negative acknowledgement (API_LAS_INVALID_SESSION_NO) else confirm will be received.
If an unknown list identifier is requested FP will answer back with negative acknowledgement (API_LAS_PROCEDURE_NOT_ALLOWED) else confirm will be received.
If FP reject the delete list command it will answer back with negative acknowledgement (API_LAS_PROCEDURE_NOT_ALLOWED) else confirm will be received.
It is not allowed to delete List of supported lists, Line settings List and DECT system settings list. When doing this FP will answer back with negative acknowledgement (API_LAS_PROCEDURE_NOT_ALLOWED) else confirm will be received.
This mail is used by the API to tell the MMI that all entries in a list have been deleted.

This mail is used by the MMI to request a range of entries in the list which satisfy the search criteria. The search is performed on the primary sorting field (returned as the first fieldidentifier in the API_LAS_START_SESSION_CFM message)
If session id is wrong FP will answer back with negative acknowledgement (API_LAS_INVALID_SESSION_NO) else confirm will be received.
If an unknown list entry filed identifier is requested FP will ignore field and continue.

parameter.name: SearchOption
parameter.description: Option that should be used in search

parameter.name: SearchCaseOption
parameter.description: Case option that should be used in search

parameter.name: ReadDirection
parameter.description: This enum defines the direction of received list entries.

parameter.name: ReadStatus
parameter.description: Flag for requesting setting/resetting of the 'Read status' field for all read entrie. This field only applies to a list having a 'Read status' field, and is otherwise ignored.

parameter.name: InfoElement

mail.description:
This mail is used by the API to tell MMI about the found entries in the search.
Content of list/entries is transmitted in data packets, except if no entries found.

parameter.name: StartIndex
parameter.description: Index number of first returned list entry.

mail.description:
This mail is used by the API to tell MMI that the previous command was rejected.
If the reject reason was an invalid session number the SessionIdentifier will contain the invalid number.
This mail is used by the API to send data to the MMI. The data content is distributed over several data packet messages. One entry field might be distributed over more than one data packet.

parameter.name: Last
parameter.description: Indicate if packet is the last one.

parameter.name: InfoElement

mail.description: This mail is used by the API to tell MMI that a BaseReset have been requested.
This mail is used by the API to tell MMI that an internal error has occurred in the API.
This mail is used by the MMI to query FP about the protection of fields for a list (disabled, read-only, writeable or writeable with PIN protection).
Field protection information.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Command status, either RSS_SUCCESS or RSS_NOT_SUPPORTED.

parameter.name: InfoElement

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to modify the protection of fields for a list (disabled, read-only, writeable or writeable with PIN protection).

parameter.name: InfoElement

mail.description: Field protection information.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Command status, either RSS_SUCCESS or RSS_NOT_SUPPORTED.

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to query FP about the editing status of specific lists.
Field protection information.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Command status, either RSS_SUCCESS or RSS_NOT_SUPPORTED.

parameter.name: InfoElement

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to save a default value to be used upon a default request.

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description: The InfoElement can hold a number Info Elements placed in the format (ApiInfoElementType).

mail.description: Field default value information.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Command status, either RSS_SUCCESS or RSS_NOT_SUPPORTED.

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to clear a specified list in FP. This command can only be used with a Phoenix based FPs which support LAS and should only be used for debug/test purpose and not for application use.

parameter.name: ListIdentifier
parameter.description: Id of list to clear. Any list can be cleared from any session. If API_LAS_SUPPORTED_LISTS is selected all lists are cleared

mail.description: This mail is used by the API to inform the MMI that the list has been cleared. This command can only be used with a Phoenix based FPs which support LAS and should only be used for debug/test purpose and not for application use.
